intro: Psychotria dewevrei, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Psychotria dewevrei is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
